verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%>, to Jeduthun <S%H3038><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph <S%H623><s%>. I cried <S%H6817><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%> with my voice <S%H6963><s%>, even unto God <S%H430><s%> with my voice <S%H6963><s%>; and he gave ear <S%H238><s%> unto me. of: or, for

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble <S%H6869><s%> I sought <S%H1875><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%>: my sore <S%H3027><s%> ran <S%H5064><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>, and ceased <S%H6313><s%> not: my soul <S%H5315><s%> refused <S%H3985><s%> to be comforted <S%H5162><s%>. sore: Heb. hand
I remembered <S%H2142><s%> God <S%H430><s%>, and was troubled <S%H1993><s%>: I complained <S%H7878><s%>, and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> was overwhelmed <S%H5848><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
Thou holdest <S%H270><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%> waking <S%H8109><s%>: I am so troubled <S%H6470><s%> that I cannot speak <S%H1696><s%>.
I have considered <S%H2803><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>, the years <S%H8141><s%> of ancient times <S%H5769><s%>.

I call to remembrance <S%H2142><s%> my song <S%H5058><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>: I commune <S%H7878><s%> with mine own heart <S%H3824><s%>: and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> made diligent search <S%H2664><s%>.
Will the Lord <S%H136><s%> cast off <S%H2186><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>? and will <S%H3254><s%> he be favourable <S%H7521><s%> no more?

Is his mercy <S%H2617><s%> clean gone <S%H656><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%>? doth his promise <S%H562><s%> fail <S%H1584><s%> for evermore <S%H1755><s%> <S%H1755><s%>? for evermore: Heb. to generation and generation?
Hath God <S%H410><s%> forgotten <S%H7911><s%> to be gracious <S%H2589><s%>? hath he in anger <S%H639><s%> shut up <S%H7092><s%> his tender mercies <S%H7356><s%>? Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
And I said <S%H559><s%>, This is my infirmity <S%H2470><s%>: but I will remember the years <S%H8141><s%> of the right hand <S%H3225><s%> of the most High <S%H5945><s%>.
I will remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H2142><s%> the works <S%H4611><s%> of the LORD <S%H3050><s%>: surely I will remember <S%H2142><s%> thy wonders <S%H6382><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>.
I will meditate <S%H1897><s%> also of all thy work <S%H6467><s%>, and talk <S%H7878><s%> of thy doings <S%H5949><s%>.
Thy way <S%H1870><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, is in the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%>: who is so great <S%H1419><s%> a God <S%H410><s%> as our God <S%H430><s%>?
Thou art the God <S%H410><s%> that doest <S%H6213><s%> wonders <S%H6382><s%>: thou hast declared <S%H3045><s%> thy strength <S%H5797><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%>.
Thou hast with thine arm <S%H2220><s%> redeemed <S%H1350><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%>, the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> and Joseph <S%H3130><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.

The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> thee, O God <S%H430><s%>, the waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> thee; they were afraid <S%H2342><s%>: the depths <S%H8415><s%> also were troubled <S%H7264><s%>.

The clouds <S%H5645><s%> poured out <S%H2229><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>: the skies <S%H7834><s%> sent out <S%H5414><s%> a sound <S%H6963><s%>: thine arrows <S%H2687><s%> also went abroad <S%H1980><s%>. poured: Heb. were poured forth with water

The voice <S%H6963><s%> of thy thunder <S%H7482><s%> was in the heaven <S%H1534><s%>: the lightnings <S%H1300><s%> lightened <S%H215><s%> the world <S%H8398><s%>: the earth <S%H776><s%> trembled <S%H7264><s%> and shook <S%H7493><s%>.
Thy way <S%H1870><s%> is in the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and thy path <S%H7635><s%> in the great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>, and thy footsteps <S%H6119><s%> are not known <S%H3045><s%>.
Thou leddest <S%H5148><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> like a flock <S%H6629><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%>.
